text: 750 ml bottle. Pours a clear golden orange color and topped by a nice, smooth head of off white foam that quickly settles to a thin film with some solid lacing. The aroma shows notes of tart and juicy grapefruit, salinity from the salt, crisp wheat, some earthy minerals, and lactic sourness. The flavor follows with the juicy red grapefruit, some lemon, crisp wheat, earthy minerals, some lactic sourness, yogurt, and a nice saltiness on the finish. The sourness is there but not overpowering. Light in body with ample carbonation that leads to a tart, salty, and juicy grapefruit finish. Very crisp, refreshing, easy to drink and definitely crushable. Every sip dries out and begs for another. Really tasty stuff and a top notch Gose.

Draft at Brouwerij Lane in Brooklyn. Clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma is nice grapefruit, damp earth, salt. Nicely tart, fruity, and mildly salty flavor. Medium bodied, fairly lively feel, some bite. Good.

750ml bottled acquired via Homer321. Thanks as always, Sean. Pours a darker lightly hazed pour of gold, a kiss of ruby red glow and some dulled fall glow on the edges. Frothy whitish head atop leaves a decent film, good ringer that laces solid. Aromas are lactic, punchy, citric. A bit of salinity, earthy mineral appeal with punchy lemon and grapefruit, pithy appeal, straw and mellow bready malts. Clean, fun, a touch of lime. Initial is light bodied, salty and sour. Punchy lactic appeal is pleasant, grapefruit and lemon, a bit of straw, yogurt, some sea salt earthy salinity. Straw, wheat, a yogurty trail and punchy lactic punch. Limes, grapefruit, bitter rind, tart pithy fruit. A decent sour kick but no interfering acidity. A touch flabby on the carbonation front, but this one works pretty well as far as flavors go. Tart, sour, dry, a salty touch, citric life, mellow crushable body overall. Solid nose and pour, much more on point flavors and flow as far as its strength. Enjoyable stuff.
Bottle at tasting event. Pours clear gold. Aroma and flavor are wheat, lactic funk, citrus, some sea salt, and a crisp, tart mouthfeel. Light/medium body.
Pours clear straw color with white head. Citrus aroma. Grapefruit, lemon, and salt flavors. Light body with lively carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Homer! Pours clear golden apple, small fizzy white head, dissipates quickly, minimal lacing. Aroma is sour mash, citrus and sea air. Flavor is light plus tart, grapefruit, lime, sea salt noticeable. Light body. Agreed with Homer - super crushable. This is pretty much the beer I want my fridge full of, preferably in 12 oz cans.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Light salty, sour fruit, oak and tart aromas. Flavors are light, oak, salty, fruit, tart finish.

Draft at Whole Foods in NYC.

Clear, pale golden body. Slow effervescence with a small white collar. Aromas of lemons, salt, cracker. Tart and tangy flavor with lingering salt presence. Light on the palate with a mild pucker in the cheeks. Solid.

Super lactic sour nose. Light lemon. Fairly clear pale straw color. Taste is not as sour as aroma would indicate. Lightly salty. A tad light in carbonation but otherwise this is a nice Gose. Not too sweet and malty, and not too sour. Crushable
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2016 Bottle - pours yellow orange white head - nose/taste of fresh lemon zest, tangy lemon citrus, sea salt and light sour lactose - lighter medium body
